intro: Lifago dielsii, commonly known as the Diels' lifago, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences. Lifago dielsii is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in the understory of dense forests.
